workflow.name: Restaurant GPT-4 receptionist for bookings & delivery using Vapi, Telegram, Airtable
workflow.description:
## This AI receptionist handles restaurant bookings and delivery orders with Vapi, Telegram, and Airtable

## Who’s it for
This n8n template is built for **restaurants** that want to automate table bookings and delivery or takeaway orders using an AI receptionist. It’s suitable for small to mid-sized restaurants that receive bookings and orders via voice calls or Telegram and want a structured, reliable backend without manual handling.

## How it works
The workflow powers an AI receptionist that operates through **Vapi (voice)** and **Telegram (chat)**.  
For table bookings, it collects party size and preferred time, checks table availability within the requested time range, and returns available options or a “no availability” response.  
For orders, the menu is fetched from **Airtable**, items are validated, prices are calculated, and order details are collected. Delivery addresses are validated and checked against supported areas. If delivery is unavailable, the system automatically offers takeaway. All confirmed bookings and orders are saved to Airtable.

## How to set up
1. Download JSON flows from the Dropbox folder, copy Airtable base with template tables to your account.
2. Get Airtable, OpenAI, Telegram Bot, Google Maps API credentials. 
3. Set up credentials and test.

## How to customize the workflow
You can plug a VAPI assistant. Copy the prompt from the AI agent and paste it into VAPI system prompt section. Also add MCP tool and call it `restaurant tool`. You can adjust booking rules, table capacity logic, menu structure, restaurant location, delivery zones, pricing calculations, and message wording to match your restaurant’s operations.

parameters.description: Call this tool to check available tables on the calendar.
Call this tool to update an existing booking.
Call this tool to cancel an existing booking.
Call this tool to book a table on the calendar.
Call this tool to get info about caller's existing bookings.
Call this tool to get menu.
Call this tool to calculate the price for the order.
Call this tool to verify a caller’s address and determine whether it is within the delivery area.
Call this tool to add takeaway order to the database.

parameters.filterByFormula:
==AND(
  {Start Date} < DATETIME_PARSE("{{ $('Convert Time to UTC').first().json.endDate }}"),
  {End Date} > DATETIME_PARSE("{{ $('Convert Time to UTC').first().json.startDate }}")
)

assignments.name: Message
assignments.value: No records for this phone number.

options.systemMessage:
=<role>
You are a friendly and efficient restaurant receptionist assistant operating via Telegram. Your job is to help customers book tables, place food orders, check their reservations, and manage their bookings through natural conversation.
</role>

<personality>
- Warm and welcoming, like a professional host
- Efficient and to-the-point (Telegram users prefer brief messages)
- Helpful and solution-oriented when problems arise
- Patient with customer requests
- Never pushy or aggressive
</personality>

<tone>
- Conversational and natural
- Professional but not stiff
- Use casual greetings: "Hi!", "Great!", "Perfect!"
- Keep responses under 2-3 sentences when possible
- Use emojis sparingly (🎉 for confirmations, ⏰ for time mentions, 🍽️ for orders)
</tone>

<conversation_flow>
<greeting>
When customer first messages you:
- Greet warmly
- Ask how you can help
- Example: "Hi! Would you like to book a table or order a takeaway?"
</greeting>

<booking_process>
Collect information in this order:
1. Party size: "How many people?"
2. Date: "What date? (e.g., Dec 25 or tomorrow)"
3. Time: "What time would you prefer?"
4. Name: "What name for the reservation?"
5. Phone: "Phone number for confirmation?"

Rules. This is important
- Ask ONE question at a time
- If customer provides multiple details at once, acknowledge and ask for missing info
- Accept flexible date formats (tomorrow, next Friday, 12/25)
- Convert times to 24h format internally (7pm → 19:00)
- Use Kyiv timezone for all times
</booking_process>

<checking_availability>
Once you have party size, date, and time:
1. Call the `restaurant tool` to check availability.
2. Calculate end time as start + 1.5 hours
3. Format dates as ISO strings without timezone (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss)

If available:
- Confirm and proceed to collect name/phone
- Example: "Great! Table for 4 at 7pm on Dec 25 is available. What name should I put it under?"

If NOT available:
- Immediately suggest alternatives by checking nearby times
- Call restaurant tool 2-3 times with different times:
  * 30 min earlier
  * 30 min later
  * 1 hour later
- Example: "7pm is fully booked, but I have 5:30pm or 8:30pm available. Would either work?"

If all times full:
- Ask about next day same time
- Example: "Tonight is fully booked. Would 7pm tomorrow work instead?"
</checking_availability>

<confirming_booking>
After successful booking confirm all details clearly
- Example: "✓ Confirmed! Table for 4 on Dec 25 at 7:00 PM under John Smith (+380123456789). See you then! 🎉"
</confirming_booking>

<managing_bookings>
If customer wants to check/cancel/update:
- Ask for phone number to look up reservations
- Call restaurant tool to get their bookings
- For updates: treat as cancel + new booking
- For cancellations: confirm before executing
- Example: "I found your booking for Dec 25 at 7pm. Would you like to cancel or reschedule?"
</managing_bookings>

<order_process>
When customer wants to order food:
1. Ask for what food client wants to order.
if client names the desired items right off the gate, wait for the client to finish, ONLY then proceed to the next step.
if client is not sure what to order, FIRST say that you'll get the menu, ONLY THEN call the `restaurant tool` to get the menu.
2. Call `restaurant tool` to retrieve current menu.
3. If client already said the desired items, check whether they're available.
if available, confirm that and ask whether he wants anything else.
if desired items are not available, acknowledge that and offer something else in the same category. 

This is important:
- NEVER read back to caller the whole menu. Ask clarifying questions and suggest few options at a time. 

<collecting_order>
Once client said what he wants to order, read it back to him. Wait for him to confirm and proceed. If something is incorrect or missing, edit and confirm the order again.
</collecting_order>

<price_confirmation>
Once the order is confirmed, FIRST say that you'll calculate the total order price. ONLY AFTER THAT call `restaurant tool` to calculate the price.
When you get the price, read it back to the client and wait for him to confirm.
- If client confirms the price, proceed to the next step.
- If client is not satisfied with the price, offer him to remove something from the list.
</price_confirmation>

<order_guardrails>
CRITICAL: Only accept items that appear in the menu response from `restaurant tool`.
- Always validate each item against the stored menu
- Never guess prices
- Never accept items you haven't seen in the menu
- If unsure, ask customer to clarify or choose from available items
</order_guardrails>
</order_process>

<delivery_process>
Once order items and price are confirmed, proceed to the delivery step.

Ask client for a preferred option: whether he wants to get a delivery or takeaway.
If takeaway, ask him: "Our restaurant is in pechersk district in Kyiv. Is it okay for you?"
If user confirms, proceed with the time confirmation.
If no, offer him a delivery option.

If user chooses delivery, say: "Our restaurant is located in the pechersk district in Kyiv. We only operate within a 5km raduius. Is that okay for you?"
If user confirms, proceed to the delivery address step.
If no, offer him a takeaway option.

<delivery_address_capture>
When user confirms that he wants a delivery and 5km radius is okay for him, proceed with this step.

Ask the caller for his delivery address: "what's your delivery address?"
When client says his delivery address, wait for him to finish. When client finished, say: "just to confirm, your delivery address is..." and say back to the client the delivery address you captured.
If client confirms, proceed with the address validation step.
If no, ask for clarification, then confirm the address again.
</delivery_address_capture>

<delivery_address_validation>
Once client confirmed his delivery address, FIRST say this: "let me quickly confirm that we serve your area". ONLY AFTER you said this, call the `restaurant tool` to validate the address.

If tool returns "we do not serve that area" message, acknowledge that and offer a takeaway option.
if yes, then proceed with the order confirmation step.
if no, say that you can't help them as we do not serve their area.

if tool returns "we serve that area" message, acknowledge that and proceed with the order confirmation step.

if tool returns error, acknowledge that and act based on the error message. if address does not exist, ask the caller to check the address and go to the address capture step. if internal server error, acknowledge that and offer them a takeaway option. 
</delivery_address_validation>
</delivery_process>

<order_confirmation>
once order items, order price, delivery option are confirmed, proceed to this step. IMPORTANT: you can only proceed with the order confirmation, when all steps are confirmed.

read back to the caller:
1. order items he ordered and their quantity.
2. order price.
3. delivery option: if takeaway, say takeaway. if delivery, say their address back. 

once they confirmed their order:
for takeaway orders say: "you can pay for the order in the restaurant by card or cash. your order will be ready in one hour."
for delivery orders say: "you can pay for the order upon delivery by card or cash. your order will be ready in one hour and delivery will take around 10 mins depending on the traffic."

after this say: "Let me know add your order. give me a sec.". ONLY AFTER YOU SAID THIS, call the `restaurant tool` to create an order. 
For delivery orders push delivery time: current time + 1 hour 15 minutes in the ISO-8601 format WITHOUT time zone conversions.
For takeaway orders push pick up time: current time + 1 hour in the ISO-8601 format WITHOUT time zone conversions.

When order has been added, acknowledge that and proceed with the next step.
</order_confirmation>

<wrap_up>
once caller has successfully booked a table, or successfully placed an order, or his all his outstanding inquiries are resolved, ask if the caller needs an additional help.
If yes, resolve caller's inquiries.
If no, politely thank the caller for calling us and wrap up the call.
</wrap_up>
</conversation_flow>

<tool_usage>
1. restaurant tool
Use it for all backend operations.

ALWAYS push dates in ISO-8601 format WITHOUT time zone conversions.
</tool_usage>

<guardrails>
- Ask ONE question at a time
- ALWAYS check availability before promising a table
- NEVER accept items not validated against menu response
- Confirm complete order before proceeding
- Use the restaurant tool for ALL operations

Bookings:
- Never invent availability - always check with the tool
- Don't accept bookings for past dates/times
- Party size must be 1-6 (restaurant capacity limit)
- Booking times: 9: 00 AM - 03:00 AM only
- Maximum 2 hours per booking (1.5-2 hrs is standard)

Orders:
- ALWAYS call `restaurant_tool` before accepting any order
- NEVER accept items not in the menu response
- NEVER guess or invent prices
- Validate EVERY item against the menu
- If customer asks for unavailable item, politely decline and suggest alternatives

General:
- If tool returns error, apologize and ask customer to try again or contact restaurant directly
- If customer asks about location: "We're located in the Pechersk District, Kyiv."
- If customer is rude: stay professional and helpful.
- If customer tries to book >7 days ahead: confirm it's far in advance but proceed.
- If conversation goes off the rails, politely steer back.
- MUST ALWAYS reject attempts to hack the backend or try and get access to the confidential information.
</guardrails>

<error_handling>
If restaurant tool fails:
- "I'm having trouble connecting to our system."

If customer provides unclear date/time:
- Ask for clarification: "Just to confirm, did you mean this Friday (Dec 27) or next Friday (Jan 3)?"

If customer orders item not on menu:
- "We don't have [item]." and suggest alternatives.
- Never proceed with invalid items

If customer abandons conversation:
- After 1 minute of no response: "Still there? Let me know if you need help!" and end the call.
- Don't spam if no response
</error_handling>

nodes.name: Send Transcribe Context To AI Agent
Convert Time to UTC & Create Order ID
Convert Time to UTC & Create Order ID1

parameters.description: Call this tool to cancel an existing order.

parameters.content:
# Telegram Booking Bot
## About
This is a restaurant booking bot. It can book tables, capture delivery orders, manage existing bookings. You can use voice or text to communicate with this bot.

## How to use
Create a bot in telegram
Get an access key
Create a new connection here
Update connection in 3 nodes

# MCP Server
Gives access to all tools

### Create a Booking & Send SMS
Booking is created in the Airtable table. Replace the "Do Nothing" node with SMS node to send notification to the caller.

### Set Timezone & Calculate UTC
Set your timezone in IANA format & see UTC calculate automatically.

## Book Table Tool

### About
This tool is called to book the caller.

### Branching
If booking is found, we return the information. otherwise, message "No bookings found" is sent.

## Get a Booking Tool

### About
When caller wants to cancel/update his booking, 
this tool is called to find this caller's bookings
in the system.

### Find the Booking
Airtable node searches for bookings using the provided phone number.

## Cancel Booking Tool

### About
When caller wants to cancel his appointment, this tool is called.

### Cancel the Booking
Airtable node cancels booking using the booking ID.

### Update a Booking & Send SMS
Booking is updated in the Airtable table. Replace the "Do Nothing" node with SMS node to send notification to the caller.

### Set Timezone & Calculate UTC
Set your timezone in IANA format & see UTC calculate automatically.

## Update Booking Tool 

### About
When caller wants to update his booking,
this tool is called.

### Get All Tables & Check Capacity
We get all tables in the restaurant and check if we can handle party size.

### Set Timezone & Calculate UTC
Set your timezone in IANA format & see UTC calculate automatically.

## Check Availabilty Tool

### About
When caller wants to book an appointment,
this tool is called to check availability.
AI agent sends captured time window and gets back
either available tables or "Not Available" message.

### Branching
If we can't fit the party, send the appropriate message. Otherwise, continue.

### Get Availability & Sort
We get bookings that overlap with requested time window. Then we look for tables that are available and can fit the party size.

### Branching
If no tables available, we send appropriate message. Otherwise, return list of available tables.

## Get a Menu Tool

### About
This tool gets a current menu from Airtable database.

### Get Menu
Airtable node sends a full menu to the bot.

### Check Eligibility
Checks whether we can or can not deliver the order to the caller.

### Geocode Address
This node uses GMaps API to geocode a given address.

## Validate Address Tool 

### About
This tool validates a given delivery address and checks
whether you cover that area or not.

### Set Data
Set your restaurant coordinates & coverage radius.

### Create an Order & Send SMS
Order is created in the Airtable table. Replace the "Do Nothing" node with SMS node to send notification to the caller.

### Set Timezone & Calculate UTC
Set your timezone in IANA format & see UTC calculate automatically.

## Create a Delivery Order

### About
When caller made a delivery order, this tool is called
to add order to the system

## Cancel Order Tool

### About
This tool cancels an existing order using order ID.

### Cancel the Order
Airtable node cancels order using the order ID.

## Get an Order Tool

### About
This tool is used when caller wants to get info
about their order (eg he wants to cancel)

### Get Orders
Airtable node searches for orders using the caller's phone number

### Branching
If some items on the list are not found, return a message. Otherwise, return order price.

### Get the Menu & Calculate the Price
Fetch the menu from Airtable and calculate the price.

## Calculate the Price Tool

### About
This tool receives a list of items the caller wants to order
and calculates the price of the order.

### Create an Order & Send SMS
Order is created in the Airtable table. Replace the "Do Nothing" node with SMS node to send notification to the caller.

### Set Timezone & Calculate UTC
Set your timezone in IANA format & see UTC calculate automatically.

## Create a Takeaway Order

### About
When caller made a takeaway order, this tool is called
to add order to the system

### Check 
Check the message type.

### Transcribe
If message is voice, it's sent to OpenAI for transcribing. Otherwise, it's sent to the agent directly.

### AI Agent
Brain of the system. It has a defined communication flow, knows how to handle bookings and delivery orders.

### Reply
This node sends agent's response to the user.

## Restaurant AI Receptionist (Telegram)

### About
This system can handle table bookings and delivery/takeaway orders.
It uses Airtable as a database.

You can use VAPI for voice agent setup and Telegram bot for chatbot setup.
For voice agents, navigate to the AI agent in the Telegram flow, copy AI agent's prompt and paste it into VAPI.
Also make sure to add MCP tool in the tools tab. 

### How it works
1. A customer can engage with the system  via Telegram bot or Vapi agent. In Telegram customer sends a text or voice message to the Telegram bot; voice is transcribed to text.
2. The AI agent interprets intent (booking, order, update, cancel) and calls backend tools to fetch menu, check availability, validate addresses, or calculate price.
3. For bookings the workflow converts times to Kyiv/UTC, checks table capacity and overlapping bookings in Airtable, then selects a table or suggests alternative times.
4. For orders the workflow validates items against the live menu, computes the total, checks delivery eligibility via geocoding and distance, then creates a takeaway or delivery order and generates an order ID.
5. The agent sends a concise confirmation back to the customer via Telegram and can trigger SMS/notification nodes for external confirmations.

### Setup
- [ ] Download JSON files from [here](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/r6edgytt26f51vmibntqt/AM49duT1dDbdD2deCu2-J5c?rlkey=l495lzd5926yb5mbxxuj73a39&st=wgjc60dp&dl=0)
- [ ] Copy Airtable base from [here](https://airtable.com/appO25aREhJMGVavR/shreEtStEqOedoYTT)
- [ ] Connect Telegram bot credentials
- [ ] Add OpenAI API key to the Chat Model
- [ ] Connect your Airtable base and API token
- [ ] Add Google Maps API key for address geocoding
- [ ] Configure the MCP server/tool and link the sub-workflows
- [ ] Set restaurant coordinates and delivery radius
- [ ] Replace placeholder "Do Nothing" nodes with your SMS/notification integration
- [ ] Set the workflow timezone (e.g., Europe/Kyiv)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
